docs.lead_paragraph: How much does malpractice cost the medical system? About $55.6 billion a year, or 2.4 percent of annual health care spending, according to a study on medical liability published today in Health Affairs.

headline.main: The Week Ahead in Health Industry News

docs.abstract: This week focuses on news about emergency room visits and the ramifications of the health care law.

docs.lead_paragraph: As more immigrants crowd their waiting rooms, a growing number of hospitals are adopting practices intended to improve care for an increasingly diverse patient population.

docs.lead_paragraph: We've all had this experience, haven't we? A neighbor or friend is struggling through an illness or a family emergency, so we offer our sympathy and help. ''You tell them to call you anytime, 24/7,'' said Hal Chapel, an entrepreneur in Maynard, Mass. ''You mean it, and they believe it -- and it never happens because they're absorbed in the crisis.''

docs.lead_paragraph: In a year of unremitting labor, Democrats now turn toward the final phase of their most arduous task of all.

headline.main: Democrats Go to Work on a Formidable Task

docs.abstract: In a year of unremitting labor, Democrats now turn toward framing an election-year message on the economy when the economy, under their leadership, is weak.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a year of unremitting labor, Democrats now turn toward the final phase of their most arduous task of all. That task is framing an election-year message on the economy when the economy, under their leadership, is weak.

headline.main: Democrats Go to Work on a Formidable Task

docs.abstract: Caucus column on election-year efforts by Democrats to shape message on economy which, under their leadership, is weak; Democrats hope to undercut Republican arguments that Democrats are hostile to entrepreneurs and to promote business-friendly tax cuts (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: With just over two months before the midterm elections, party leaders are solidifying their strategies and rallying their troops.
